page.title: 18Ecology-The Marsh-Dymchurch
page.content: The marsh in Dymchurch is 6ft below sea level.The soil is marine alluvium drained by many dykes.Most of the marshland is owned by farmers.They use it to grow peas,winter wheat,barley, potatoes,oil seed rape and as sheep pasture.There are not many trees: haw- thorn is the most common.Grasses in- clude:foxtail grass,couch,wild creep- ing bent & sea couch.There are vetch, white clover,thistles & buttercups. Romney Marsh is a home for rabbits,fox -es,fieldmice,rats,dragonflies,butter- flies,beetles,ants & moths.Most of the ponds are bomb craters from World War 2.The ponds hide many creatures like moorhens,herons,mallards,newts,skaters & leeches.The birds of the marsh are crows,sparrows,pigeons,blackbirds,star -lings,seagulls,magpies,plovers & sky- larks.The birds vary in different parts of the marsh.
